params.text: Wasuze otya? Bea ali musanyufu nnyo leero
Walina okubaawo ekintu ekirungi ekyewuunyisa kye ŋŋenda okulaba.
Oh! Tewali kyewuunyisa? Buli muntu ali wa?
“ Maama, omanyi nti leero lunaku ki? ” Omukyala abuuza.  “  Leero lunaku lwa kufumba, ”  Maama ayanukula. Oh nedda!
“ Baaba, omanyi leero lunaku ki ”  Bea abuuza.  “ Leero lunaku lwa kukuba, ” mugandawe bw’agamba. Bea yewunya lwaki mugandawe tajjukira.
“ Mwanyinaze, leero lunaku ki? ”  Bea abuuza.  “ Mupiira!  Mupiira! ”  mwanyinaze bw’agamba.
Osanga mukwano gwa bea anajjukira!
“ Wakamyu, leero lunaku ki? ”  Bea abuuza. “ Leero lunaku lwa kutunga, ”  Wakamyu bw’agamba.
“ Wampeewo, leero lunaku ki? ”  Bea abuuza. “ Leero lunaku lwa makungula, “  Wampeewo ayanukula. Bea atandika okunyiiga.
Wankima agamba lunaku lwa kunoga bibala. Wakikere agamba lunaku lwa kuyimba. Wanjovu agamba lunaku lwa kusoma kitabo.
Tewali n’omu ajjukira nti leero lunaku lwa Bea olw’enjawulo!
Bea munyiivu era mukoowu.
Amazaalibwa ag’essanyu, Bea!
Mu butuufu, buli omu yajjukira! Bea musanyufu nnyo.

“Lunaku ki?” credits

This work, “Lunaku ki?” is a derivative of Hari Apakah Ini? (What Day Is It?), Author: Vannia Rizky Santoso. Illustrator: Vannia Rizky Santoso. Published by The Asia Foundation - Let's Read, https://www.letsreadasia.org © The Asia Foundation - Let's Read. Released under CC BY-NC 4.0.

“Lunaku ki?” is licensed under CC BY 4.0 by Curious Learning.

Book builder - Abraham Jerry Kakooza
